definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: The strength of an individual， as compared with that of the masses， is but a drop in the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 个人的力量和群众的力量相比，不过是沧海一粟。

sentences.english: But against the vast expanse of the sky, the chute looked very small.
sentences.chinese: 但和广阔无垠的天空相比，降落伞看起来是沧海一粟。

sentences.english: A fire-fighting helicopter approaches the blaze in Bunyip .
sentences.chinese: 沧海一粟消防直升机接近大火。

sentences.english: We know that in this respect we are part of a crowd.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道，在这一方面我们只不过是沧海一粟。

sentences.english: The universe is vast, space and time infinite, individual is only a drop in the ocean.
sentences.chinese: 宇宙浩渺，时空无限，个人只是沧海一粟。

sentences.english: But these villages are just a drop in the bucket.
sentences.chinese: 但这两个村庄只是沧海一粟。

definition: every living being (Buddhism)/the mass of common people
lit. the blue sea turned into mulberry fields (idiom)/fig. the transformations of the world
great wide world/marvelously diverse world/(Buddhism) cosmos (abbr. for 三千大千世界[san1 qian1 da4 qian1 shi4 jie4])
a white steed flits past a crack (idiom); How time flies!
vast as the open sea (idiom); fig. extensive (library)
